recipes.title: Spiced chicken couscous
recipes.description: Loaded with vegetables, this quick and tasty one-pot meal is ready in under 30 minutes. Substitute the paprika for your favourite spices and seasoning for a customised version of this spiced chicken couscous.

methods.description: Bring a drizzle of oil to medium-heat heat in a large pot. Sauté the onion, capsicum and garlic for 5 minutes or until softened.
Increase the heat to high and stir through the carrots and paprika, then add the chicken and stir fry until the chicken is almost cooked.
Add courgette, corn and two cups of water. Season with salt and pepper. Stir to combine, then bring to a boil.
Once boiling, turn off the heat. Stir through couscous, cover and leave to sit for 10 minutes for the couscous to absorb the liquid.
Fluff the couscous with a fork. Sprinkle over the sliced almonds and serve.

recipes.title: Lotus Biscoff hot cross bun trifle
recipes.description: This impressive Easter dessert is bound to gain all the attention of your friends and whānau! Luscious Lotus biscoff-filled hot cross buns, creamy custard, whipped cream and crushed Biscoff biscuits make this trifle something to remember.

methods.description: Slice each hot cross bun in half. Arrange the hot cross bun lids around the sides of a 20cm trifle bowl, cut side facing inwards. Dice the remaining hot cross buns and place them in the base of the bowl.
Dollop spoonfuls of Lotus Biscoff spread over the hot cross buns.
Spoon the custard over the Lotus Biscoff spread.
Top the trifle with whipped cream.
Crush half of the Lotus Biscoff biscuits over the top of the cream and garnish with the remaining biscuits.

recipes.title: Easy chicken and leek soup
recipes.description: A great way to use up that leftover roast chicken and make a meal for the whānau in under 25 minutes. This easy chicken and leek soup is satisfyingly hearty and full of goodness with onion, carrots, leek and thyme.

methods.description: Melt the butter in a large pot over medium-high heat.
Add the garlic, onion, leek, carrots and thyme. Cook for 8-10 minutes or until tender.
Pour in the chicken stock and bring to a simmer.
Once simmering, stir through the shredded chicken. Cook for a further 2-3 minutes, or until the chicken has heated through. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Ladle into bowls and serve while hot.

recipes.title: Sesame sriracha and honey beef skewers
recipes.description: Succulently sweet with a touch of spice, these sesame sriracha and honey beef skewers are a delicious meal for the whole whānau. Serve with steaming hot Jasmine rice and garnish with sliced spring onion for a good time. The beef can also be marinated the day before and stored in the fridge, ready for a quick meal the next day!

ingredients.name: 1kg beef rump steaks, cut into 3 cm cubes

methods.description: In a large bowl, mix together the sriracha, honey and sesame oil. Season with salt and pepper.
Add the beef and mix well until well combined. Set aside to marinate for 20 minutes.
Thread the marinated beef onto skewers.
Bring a drizzle of oil to high heat in a frying pan or grill pan. Working in batches, cook the skewers for 6-8 minutes or until cooked through, turning often.
Once cooked, set aside to rest for 5 minutes. Sprinkle with sesame seeds to serve.

recipes.title: Garlicky grilled lamb loin chops
recipes.description: Lamb chops on the barbie scream Kiwi summer. Teamed up with a spinach almond salad, these garlicky lamb loin chops are sure to be a hit over the summer season.

ingredients.name: 2 Tbsp fresh rosemary leaves, finely chopped or 1 Tbsp dried rosemary

methods.description: In a large mixing bowl combine the garlic, two tablespoons of olive oil, rosemary, and salt and pepper. Add the lamb chops, toss to coat, cover and leave to marinate for 30 minutes at room temperature.
Preheat your barbecue or grill pan to high heat. Cook the marinated lamb chops for 3-4 minutes on each side, or to your liking, then transfer to a plate and leave to rest for 5 minutes.
Make the salad dressing by combining the remaining olive oil, vinegar and cumin, salt and pepper in a small bowl. Place the spinach in a large serving bowl and drizzle over the salad dressing.
Finish with a sprinkling of sliced almonds and serve with the lamb loin chops.

recipes.title: Summer bbq meatball rolls
recipes.description: Throw an outdoor party with these summer BBQ meatball rolls. They’re delightfully packed full of flavour and suitable for the whole whānau. Assembled with garlic aioli and fresh salad leaves, these rolls couldn’t be easier.

ingredients.name: Fresh seasonal salad leaves or mesclun

methods.description: In a large bowl combine beef mince, onion, garlic, egg, paprika, mixed herbs, breadcrumbs, salt and pepper. Roll into 18 balls and set aside. Preheat your BBQ or grill pan to medium heat.
Slice the bread rolls in half and drizzle generously with olive oil. Place on the grill cut side down and cook for a few minutes or until lightly toasted.
Brush your BBQ with oil, then cook the meatballs for 2-3 minutes on each side or until cooked through.

To assemble the rolls, spread garlic aioli on one half of the bread rolls. Top with salad leaves and place 3 meatballs down the length of the roll. Finish with an extra dollop of aioli if desired and serve immediately.

recipes.title: Split green pea, spinach and miso soup
recipes.description: A light, green soup that is easy to make.

ingredients.name: 1 tablespoon toasted sesame seeds / black sesame

methods.description: In a large saucepan combine the onion, garlic, ginger, split peas and stock.
Reduce the heat to a simmer and cook for 30-40 minutes until the peas are just tender
Add the spinach and miso paste and cook a further 2 minutes.
Blend half the soup until smooth and add back to the remaining pea soup, reheat and season to taste.

recipes.title: Chicken & Salad Wraps
recipes.description: A simple but flavoursome meal even the fussiest of eaters will enjoy. Inspired by warming Indian flavours, you’ll be surprised by how quickly this delicious meal comes together! Perfect when served simply with rice, or step it up a notch and add a serving of warmed buttered naan.

methods.description: Combine the chicken and mayo in a bowl with the parsley.
Spread the wraps on a clean bench, and spread a spoonful of chutney over the wrap.
Down the centre, place the lettuce, carrot, chicken and a dollop of hummus to finish.
Fold the wrap at one end and roll.
